A previously healthy 45 years old labourer suddenly develops acute lower back pain with right-leg pain and weakness of dorsiflexion of the right great toe. Which of the following is true:

options.label: A
options.text: Immediate treatment should include analgesics muscle relaxants and back strengthening exercises.

options.label: B
options.text: The appearance of the foot drop indicate early surgical intervention.

options.label: C
options.text: If the neurological sign resolve with in 2–3 weeks but lowback pain persists, the proper treatment would include fusion of affected lumbar vertebra

options.label: D
options.text: If the neurological signs fail to resolve within 1 week,lumbar laminectomy and excision of any herniated nucleus pulposus should be done.

questions.correct_answer: B. The appearance of the foot drop indicate early surgical intervention.

questions.text: About fracture healing, all are true, except :

options.label: A
options.text: Lower limb long bones heal faster than other bones

options.label: B
options.text: Fracture in children heal faster than in adults

options.label: C
options.text: Oblique and spiral fractures heal faster than transverse fractures

questions.correct_answer: A. Lower limb long bones heal faster than other bones

questions.text: All of the following are properties of synovial fluid except :

questions.text: A 5 year old male child presents with painful hip associated with a limp for past 48 hours to the department of accidents and emergency. questions.correct_answer: D. Emergency aspiration and washout of the hip joint followed by intravenous antibiotics

questions.text: A 42- year-man is diagnosed to have irreparable tear of the rotator cuff. Treatment of choice will be?

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: ACL is broader and better visualised on MRI than PCL

options.label: C

options.label: C

questions.correct_answer: C. Tillaux - Chaput: avulsion fracture of anterior tibial margin by the anterior tibio- fibular ligament
